verses.verse: And this is the blessing<WH1293>, wherewith Moses<WH4872> the man<WH376> of God<WH430> blessed<WH1288> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> before<WH6440> his death<WH4194>.

And he said<WH559>, The LORD<WH3068> came<WH935> from Sinai<WH5514>, and rose up<WH2224> from Seir<WH8165> unto them; he shined forth<WH3313> from mount<WH2022> Paran<WH6290>, and he came<WH857> with ten thousands<WH7233> of saints<WH6944>: from his right hand<WH3225> went a fiery<WH799> <WH784> law<WH1881> for them. a fiery: Heb. a fire of law
Yea<WH637>, he loved<WH2245> the people<WH5971>; all his saints<WH6918> are in thy hand<WH3027>: and they sat down<WH8497> at thy feet<WH7272>; every one shall receive<WH5375> of thy words<WH1703>.
Moses<WH4872> commanded<WH6680> us a law<WH8451>, even the inheritance<WH4181> of the congregation<WH6952> of Jacob<WH3290>.
And he was king<WH4428> in Jeshurun<WH3484>, when the heads<WH7218> of the people<WH5971> and the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> were gathered<WH622> together<WH3162>.
Let Reuben<WH7205> live<WH2421>, and not die<WH4191>; and let not his men<WH4962> be few<WH4557>.

And this is the blessing of Judah<WH3063>: and he said<WH559>, Hear<WH8085>, LORD<WH3068>, the voice<WH6963> of Judah<WH3063>, and bring<WH935> him unto his people<WH5971>: let his hands<WH3027> be sufficient<WH7227> for him; and be thou an help<WH5828> to him from his enemies<WH6862>.

And of Levi<WH3878> he said<WH559>, Let thy Thummim<WH8550> and thy Urim<WH224> be with thy holy<WH2623> one<WH376>, whom thou didst prove<WH5254> at Massah<WH4532>, and with whom thou didst strive<WH7378> at the waters<WH4325> of Meribah<WH4809>;

Who said<WH559> unto his father<WH1> and to his mother<WH517>, I have not seen<WH7200> him; neither did he acknowledge<WH5234> his brethren<WH251>, nor knew<WH3045> his own children<WH1121>: for they have observed<WH8104> thy word<WH565>, and kept<WH5341> thy covenant<WH1285>.

They shall teach<WH3384> Jacob<WH3290> thy judgments<WH4941>, and Israel<WH3478> thy law<WH8451>: they shall put<WH7760> incense<WH6988> before<WH639> thee, and whole burnt sacrifice<WH3632> upon thine altar<WH4196>. They shall teach: or, Let them teach they shall put: or, let them put before: Heb. at thy nose

Bless<WH1288>, LORD<WH3068>, his substance<WH2428>, and accept<WH7521> the work<WH6467> of his hands<WH3027>: smite<WH4272> through the loins<WH4975> of them that rise<WH6965> against him, and of them that hate<WH8130> him, that they rise<WH6965> not<WH4480> again<WH6965>.

And of Benjamin<WH1144> he said<WH559>, The beloved<WH3039> of the LORD<WH3068> shall dwell<WH7931> in safety<WH983> by him; and the LORD shall cover<WH2653> him all the day<WH3117> long, and he shall dwell<WH7931> between his shoulders<WH3802>.

And of Joseph<WH3130> he said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> of the LORD<WH3068> be his land<WH776>, for the precious things<WH4022> of heaven<WH8064>, for the dew<WH2919>, and for the deep<WH8415> that coucheth beneath<WH7257>,
And for the precious<WH4022> fruits<WH8393> brought forth by the sun<WH8121>, and for the precious things<WH4022> put forth<WH1645> by the moon<WH3391>, put: Heb. thrust moon: Heb. moons
And for the chief things<WH7218> of the ancient<WH6924> mountains<WH2042>, and for the precious things<WH4022> of the lasting<WH5769> hills<WH1389>,

And for the precious things<WH4022> of the earth<WH776> and fulness<WH4393> thereof, and for the good will<WH7522> of him that dwelt<WH7931> in the bush<WH5572>: let the blessing come<WH935> upon the head<WH7218> of Joseph<WH3130>, and upon the top of the head<WH6936> of him that was separated<WH5139> from his brethren<WH251>.

His glory<WH1926> is like the firstling<WH1060> of his bullock<WH7794>, and his horns<WH7161> are like the horns<WH7161> of unicorns<WH7214>: with them he shall push<WH5055> the people<WH5971> together<WH3162> to the ends<WH657> of the earth<WH776>: and they are the ten thousands<WH7233> of Ephraim<WH669>, and they are the thousands<WH505> of Manasseh<WH4519>. unicorns: Heb. an unicorn
And of Zebulun<WH2074> he said<WH559>, Rejoice<WH8055>, Zebulun<WH2074>, in thy going out<WH3318>; and, Issachar<WH3485>, in thy tents<WH168>.

They shall call<WH7121> the people<WH5971> unto the mountain<WH2022>; there they shall offer<WH2076> sacrifices<WH2077> of righteousness<WH6664>: for they shall suck<WH3243> of the abundance<WH8228> of the seas<WH3220>, and of treasures<WH8226> hid<WH2934> in the sand<WH2344>.

And of Gad<WH1410> he said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be he that enlargeth<WH7337> Gad<WH1410>: he dwelleth<WH7931> as a lion<WH3833>, and teareth<WH2963> the arm<WH2220> with<WH637> the crown of the head<WH6936>.

And he provided<WH7200> the first part<WH7225> for himself, because there, in a portion<WH2513> of the lawgiver<WH2710>, was he seated<WH5603>; and he came<WH857> with the heads<WH7218> of the people<WH5971>, he executed<WH6213> the justice<WH6666> of the LORD<WH3068>, and his judgments<WH4941> with Israel<WH3478>. seated: Heb. cieled
And of Dan<WH1835> he said<WH559>, Dan<WH1835> is a lion's<WH738> whelp<WH1482>: he shall leap<WH2187> from Bashan<WH1316>.

And of Naphtali<WH5321> he said<WH559>, O Naphtali<WH5321>, satisfied<WH7649> with favour<WH7522>, and full<WH4392> with the blessing<WH1293> of the LORD<WH3068>: possess<WH3423> thou the west<WH3220> and the south<WH1864>.

And of Asher<WH836> he said<WH559>, Let Asher<WH836> be blessed<WH1288> with children<WH1121>; let him be acceptable<WH7521> to his brethren<WH251>, and let him dip<WH2881> his foot<WH7272> in oil<WH8081>.
Thy shoes<WH4515> shall be iron<WH1270> and brass<WH5178>; and as thy days<WH3117>, so shall thy strength<WH1679> be. Thy shoes: or, Under thy shoes
There is none like unto the God<WH410> of Jeshurun<WH3484>, who rideth<WH7392> upon the heaven<WH8064> in thy help<WH5828>, and in his excellency<WH1346> on the sky<WH7834>.

The eternal<WH6924> God<WH430> is thy refuge<WH4585>, and underneath are the everlasting<WH5769> arms<WH2220>: and he shall thrust out<WH1644> the enemy<WH341> from before<WH6440> thee; and shall say<WH559>, Destroy<WH8045> them.

Israel<WH3478> then shall dwell<WH7931> in safety<WH983> alone<WH910>: the fountain<WH5869> of Jacob<WH3290> shall be upon a land<WH776> of corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492>; also his heavens<WH8064> shall drop down<WH6201> dew<WH2919>.

Happy<WH835> art thou, O Israel<WH3478>: who is like unto thee, O people<WH5971> saved<WH3467> by the LORD<WH3068>, the shield<WH4043> of thy help<WH5828>, and who is the sword<WH2719> of thy excellency<WH1346>! and thine enemies<WH341> shall be found liars<WH3584> unto thee; and thou shalt tread<WH1869> upon their high places<WH1116>. found: or, subdued
